Material used.Description: Stable human neuronal cell lines (BE2 - M17) over - expressing wild - type or mutant human a - synuclein were used.

Readout description.Result Description: 45 (0.36%) genes with strong positive hybridization signals in all samples demonstrated an average of greater than two - fold increase or decrease in mRNA abundance for either wild - type or A53T a - synuclein over - expressing cell lines compared with vector - only cell line. Transcriptional activators and hydrolases were significantly altered.

Basic positive control.Description: Expression of a - synuclein mRNA was measured as a positive control for differences in gene expression.

Basic negative control.Description: A cell line containing the empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: p - values were calculated using t - tests with experimentally identified probes compared with probes present on the chip belonging each gene family.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Probes with an average fold change of less than ± 2.0 were excluded. Genes with p < 0.05 were considered statistically significant.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Probes with an average fold change of less than ± 2.0 were excluded. Genes with p < 0.05 were considered statistically significant.

Material used.Description: Total RNA was isolated from clonal cell lines (BE2 - M17) over - expressing wild - type, A30P or A53T a - synuclein and vector - only cell line.

Readout description.Result Description: The expression levels of 17 genes and a - synuclein were calculated for a further seven clones over - expressing a - synuclein and compared with two clonal cell lines containing the empty vector. 11 out of 17 genes (64.7%) had their microarray results confirmed.

Technical replicates.Description: Expression levels for each gene, for each template were calculated for four simultaneous reactions and confirmed on at least two separate reaction plates.

Basic positive control.Description: Expression of a - synuclein mRNA was measured as a positive control for differences in gene expression.

Basic negative control.Description: A cell line containing the empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The level of expression of each gene was calculated as 2(meanDDCt), where Ct is the threshold cycle, and DDCt is the difference Ct(test gene) - Ct(b - actin).

Material used.Description: Cell lysates from BE2 - M17 cells over - expressing wild - type, A30P or A53T a - synuclein were used.

Readout description.Result Description: Decreased expression of TH was clearly seen in wt a - synuclein cell lines, and not in mutant cell lines. Similar decreases in sepiapterin reductase were seen in wild - type a - synuclein cell lines.

Basic positive control.Description: Blots were reprobed with b - actin to verify equal loading.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Quantitation was performed by capturing enhanced chemiluminescence using a CCD - camera based system.

Material used.Description: BE2 - M17 cells seeded on poly D - lysine coated glass coverslips were used.

Readout description.Result Description: Decreased TH immunoreactivity was consistent across the cell population for wt a - synuclein transfected cell lines, but was similar in mutant a - synuclein cell lines to vector only controls.
